newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks close firmly, Ibex eyes 7,200 hurdle.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks close firmly, Ibex eyes 7,200 hurdle.

text.p: Madrid shares ended higher on Monday, backed by currency strength and gains on foreign markets in mainly trading-based turnover, dealers said.
The general index added 4.93 points, 0.76 percent, to 628.10 and the Ibex index rose 56.90 points, 0.8 percent, to 7,169.42.
Clear resistance for the Ibex is pegged at 7,200, but the Dow's performance will call the tune, dealers said.

"It all depends on Wall Street...but as we enter the summer months we're seeing a lot of domestic demand with not a lot of foreign acitivity. We could hit 7,200, but to me it feels a bit thin up there," said one dealer at Societe Generale.
Repsol gained 200 ptas to 6,550 on a big put through and news of a Latam natgas deal after an overhanging sell order ended, dealers said. Gas Natural rose 100 ptas to 31,800.
Some negative feeling still prevails but the stock is due to gain now after lagging the market, dealers said.

Endesa up 260 pesetas to 12,760 amid some talk of strategic stake-building. Others ruled out core investor interest, adding that upside may be capped by the prospect of the autumn public share offering.
